events.summary: Taiwan accused China of military intimidation after Beijing announced live-fire drills. It comes after Japan's prime minister said Tokyo could potentially intervene to defend the self-governing island.

events.title: Bulgaria joins the euro: Why is it a big deal?
events.summary: Becoming a euro area member demonstrates how the Bulgarian economy has improved over the past decade. But political turmoil and rising public anger over economic mismanagement and corruption pose a serious challenge.

events.title: Turkey: 9 dead in police raid on 'Islamic State' group
events.summary: The Turkish Interior Ministry mourned the loss of thee security force members as police moved in on a suspected hideout. Six Islamist militants were reported to have been killed in the operation.

events.title: Ukraine: Peace plan includes 'strong' US security guarantees
events.summary: Zelenskyy says a 15-year guarantee is part of the plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, a theater in Ukraine previously bombed by Russia has been reopened under Russian occupation. DW has more.

events.title: Uncovering the mystery behind colorful aurora skies
events.summary: The northern and southern lights, especially active lately, have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: Germany news: Fireworks back on sale, reignite ban debate
events.summary: Germany's perennial debate over safety has flared up once again as fireworks sales resume ahead of New Year. Meanwhile, a spate of black ice has caused numerous accidents across the country. Follow our updates.

events.title: AI chatbots are 'alarmingly' biased against dialect speakers
events.summary: Don't speak perfect Oxford English? You may face "shocking" levels of discrimination when using large language models, researchers have found. New customized AI models could be the answer.

events.title: Climate coverage shrinks amid Trump's clean energy misinformation
events.summary: A strong majority of Americans say they're worried about the climate. So why do they hear so little about it in the news?

events.title: Mexico: At least 13 killed in Oaxaca train derailment
events.summary: Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum said more than 90 others were injured, some of whom remained in critical condition. An investigation is now underway.

events.title: Kosovo: Kurti wins snap election, signalling end of impasse
events.summary: Prime Minister Kurti's governing Self-Determination party won nearly 50% of the vote, results showed with most of the votes counted. It is not yet clear whether he will be able to form a cabinet without a coalition.

events.title: North Korea tests long-range cruise missiles: state media
events.summary: Kim Jong Un personally oversaw the launching drill for new long‑range cruise missiles, according to state media. The test marks the latest flashpoint in tensions over Pyongyang's expanding nuclear ambitions.

events.title: Trump expects outcome for Russia-Ukraine talks in weeks
events.summary: Trump said "a lot of progress" had been made in talks with Zelenskyy at Mar-a-Lago on Sunday. The Ukrainian president described the meeting as "great." DW has the latest.

events.title: US, China hail second Cambodia-Thailand ceasefire
events.summary: Donald Trump and the Chinese foreign minister have congratulated both sides on ending months of border clashes. Since the first flare-up in May, the conflict has killed dozens and displaced hundreds of thousands.

events.title: Syria: 3 killed by security forces in Alawite protests — monitor
events.summary: Syrian authorities said they had tried to separate two groups of protesters. Demonstrations took place in several cities in Syria after an attack on an Alawite mosque on Friday.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot: Actor, icon, controversial activist
events.summary: French actress, singer and model Brigitte Bardot became an icon of the 1960s by portraying sexually emancipated characters. The animal rights activist also harbored polarizing political views.

events.title: French actress and activist Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
events.summary: The French screen legend appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and dedicating herself to animal rights activism.

events.title: Central African Republic holds elections, President Touadera seeks third term
events.summary: The President of the Central African Republic is vying for a controversial third term as polling begins in the country. Central Africans are also voting for their legislative, regional and municipal representatives.

events.title: German company to sell more refurbished appliances
events.summary: The secondhand smartphone market has grown significantly in recent years, but other, bulkier items like washing machines are less frequently refurbished and resold. That could soon be changing.

events.title: Guinea junta leader Doumbouya expected to win election
events.summary: Doumbouya, who seized power in a 2021 coup, faces weak opposition as UN warns of intimidation and restricted freedoms ahead of the vote.

events.title: Bundestag inquiry on Germany's COVID-19 response to conclude
events.summary: A parliamentary inquiry has been looking into the policy decisions made to contain the coronavirus pandemic in Germany. The decisions made by key leaders from the time are being questioned.

events.title: Major winter storm sweeps across Nordic states
events.summary: A falling branch killed one person near a Swedish ski resort. Thousands of homes in Finland, Sweden and Norway were left without power.

events.title: Germany: Drones disrupt air traffic in Hanover
events.summary: Several flights were diverted after at least five drones were spotted near an airport in northern Germany.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi and football's growing issue: playing time
events.summary: According to a new FIFPRO report, Morocco and Paris Saint-Germain star Achraf Hakimi is a footballer at his limit, having had a season that lasted nearly a whole year. After an injury, he is now at AFCON with Morocco.

events.title: Germany at the 2026 World Cup: What next?
events.summary: Now that they have qualified and drawn in group E, Germany head into the final part of their 2026 World Cup preparations. Here's what to know.

events.title: Fax and furious: Why Germany struggles to go digital
events.summary: Germany, the land of tech pioneers, still relies on fax and paper for basic public services. Why is digital government stuck in the slow lane while Denmark and India race ahead?

events.title: Peak oil: Why the world can't break its fossil fuel habit
events.summary: Climate change shifted the oil production debate from scarcity to demand. If countries do not deliver on ambitious green pledges, one expert predicts that production may peak within two years, forcing a chaotic decline.

events.title: Berlin: Archaeologists on a treasure hunt in the capital
events.summary: As traces of the Middle Ages are uncovered in the heart of Berlin, a new museum — PETRI Berlin — has been founded to house these discoveries.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Russia pummels Kyiv, Zelenskyy heads to US
events.summary: Russia launched missile and drone strikes on Kyiv and other Ukrainian regions, ahead of President Volodmyr Zelenskyy's key meeting with US President Trump.

events.title: Munich surfers abandon attempt to restart Eisbach wave
events.summary: City authorities are putting up unnecessary resistance to restoring the world-famous surf spot, the local sports association said.

events.title: Football: Afghan women make statement on international stage
events.summary: Afghanistan's female footballers have been fighting in exile to get back to playing internationally for years. Earlier this year, their moment arrived, but their mission is far from complete.

events.title: Germany's empty churches repurposed as congregations shrink
events.summary: The number of practicing Christians in Germany is falling. The result is surplus churches. What happens to these empty houses of worship?

events.title: Ukraine updates: Kyiv hits Russian refinery with UK missiles
events.summary: Ukraine said it used British Storm Shadow missiles to attack the Novoshakhtinsk oil refinery. Zelenskyy said he spoke with Trump's envoys on how to end the war.

events.title: Can dogs really sense danger?
events.summary: Research shows what canines really can sense — and how social media and human projection fuel belief in their supernatural abilities.

events.title: From Ukraine to US: Germany's 2026 foreign policy challenges
events.summary: Germany enters 2026 facing a world in upheaval. Whether navigating relations with the United States, Ukraine, China or Middle Eastern governments, Germany is struggling to keep pace with rapid geopolitical shifts.

events.title: The Christmas truce of 1914: When the guns fell silent
events.summary: On Christmas Eve 1914, battling German and British soldiers laid down their arms and sang Christmas carols together — a brief moment of peace in the midst of war.

events.title: Germany's far-right AfD may seize regional power in 2026
events.summary: The Alternative for Germany (AfD) will seek power in next year's state elections. Civil society groups are alarmed, as are security services, which have found that some of its factions represent extremist threats.

events.title: 7 mysterious languages that have yet to be deciphered
events.summary: Indus, Rongorongo, Linear A: Some ancient writing systems cannot be deciphered. Can artificial intelligence help crack the codes of the past?

events.title: Kosovo: Will elections break the political gridlock?
events.summary: Kosovo hasn't had a functioning parliament since the February 2025 election. All attempts to form a governing coalition have failed. It's hoped fresh elections will provide a way forward, but many voters are skeptical.

events.title: How Germany's Deutsche Bahn aims to fix chronic delays
events.summary: German trains used to run like clockwork. Today, delays are the rule, not the exception. As public anger is boiling over, what went wrong with a system once envied worldwide, and why are the Swiss getting it right?

events.title: Ryanair faces massive fine in Italy over 'abusive strategy'
events.summary: Italy's competition authority AGCM claims the budget airline blocked payment methods and mass-deleted accounts to manipulate travel agencies and force them into partnerships. Ryanair has pledged to appeal the fine.

events.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un, daughter open luxury resort
events.summary: Five new hotels were opened in Samjiyon, near the Chinese border, with Kim Jong Un praising the "rising status" of North Korea's people.

events.title: This is how Christmas is celebrated at the Vatican
events.summary: This year, Pope Leo XIV will lead the Christmas celebrations at the Vatican for the first time. But the popular Christmas traditions at the heart of the Roman Catholic Church remain unchanged.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy cautiously optimistic about peace talks
events.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that while no side is likely to get all of its demands, Kyiv will not accept "some things." Follow DW for the latest.

events.title: UK: Banksy unveils latest mural in London
events.summary: Two identical artworks have appeared on the streets of London, at least one of which has been officially claimed by the mysterious artist Banksy. But what is Banksy trying to tell us just days before Christmas?

events.title: Why Trump backs Bayer in Roundup weedkiller cancer battle
events.summary: The Trump administration has diverged from the position of former US President Joe Biden, throwing its weight behind German chemical giant Bayer in its courtroom battle over the pesticide Roundup.

events.title: UK: 'Driving Home For Christmas' singer Chris Rea dies
events.summary: The guitarist and songwriter Chris Rea passed away after a short illness, his family said. His Christmas song became an integral part of the holiday spirit around the world.

events.title: AFCON: A 3,000-kilometer bike ride to catch the opener
events.summary: The Africa Cup of Nations is drawing thousands of fans to Morocco, and one chose an unusual way to get there. Moroccan fan Ismail Skira cycled thousands of kilometers from Paris for the opening match.

events.title: Denmark fumes over new US envoy to Greenland
events.summary: US President Donald Trump's newly named envoy has said he hopes to help "make Greenland part of the US." Denmark, which controls the autonomous island, is "deeply angered" according to its foreign minister.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.summary: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
events.summary: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

events.title: Germany registers over 1,000 suspicious drone flights in 2025
events.summary: Drone sightings this year have disrupted German airports, causing headaches for travelers. Germany has ordered special anti-aircraft tanks to combat the unmanned aerial vehicles.

events.title: France to build new aircraft carrier — Macron
events.summary: Macron said that France needed to be "strong to be feared" as Paris aims to enhance its projection as a naval power.

events.title: France: 3 suspects in Elysee Palace silverware theft to stand trial
events.summary: France's presidential silverware keeper and two other men are suspected of stealing thousands of euros' worth of porcelain and other tableware from the president's official residence.

events.title: AI language models duped by poems
events.summary: A new study has shown that prompts in the form of poems confuse AI models like ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude — to the point where sometimes, security mechanisms don't kick in. Are poets the new hackers?

events.title: Germany: 1,600 asylum requests by people rejected at border
events.summary: The German government said hundreds of people turned away at the border later applied for asylum. Meanwhile, Berlin's mayor is warning New Year's Eve's trouble makers. DW has the latest.

events.title: Germany trains immigrant teachers to fill gaps in schools
events.summary: Germany is desperately looking for teachers. And many migrants and refugees were once teachers in their home country. A program in Cologne — and four other cities — is hoping to create a win-win situation.

events.title: Mercosur summit: Lula, Milei clash over US-Venezuela tensions
events.summary: Speaking at a Mercosur summit, Lula warned that a US invasion of Venezuela could spark a humanitarian crisis. The Brazilian leader also called on the EU to show "courage" and conclude a deal with the South American bloc.

events.title: German engineer becomes first wheelchair user to visit space
events.summary: German engineer Michaela Benthaus, who has paraplegia, traveled to space with Jeff Bezos' company Blue Origin.

events.title: How Georgian creatives are fighting for their freedom
events.summary: Artists in Georgia are weary but defiant as they face arbitrary arrests, tough new laws and financial hardship from the country's repressive government.

events.title: 'Avatar': How the Na'vi language was constructed
events.summary: Very few people get to invent a new language that is heard by millions: DW talked to linguist Paul Frommer about how he developed the "Avatar" aliens' language.

events.title: Perfume's multicultural journey: From antiquity to TikTok
events.summary: Though often marketed through a Eurocentric lens, perfume's multilayered history spans Mesopotamia, India, Egypt and Europe, besides being retold on PerfumeTok.

events.title: Labor rights in Europe: Who's working over Christmas?
events.summary: From the number of paid days off to the size of the Christmas bonus, not all European countries are equal for workers over the holidays.

events.title: Christmas brings rise in domestic violence in Germany
events.summary: For many women, the holiday season is the most dangerous time of the year. Stress, financial worries, and cramped living conditions increase the risk of domestic violence. Women's shelters are overstretched.

events.title: Rome to introduce entry fee for historic Trevi Fountain
events.summary: Rome's mayor said tourists will have to pay to get close to Trevi Fountain, one of the Italian capital's most popular monuments, starting in February.

events.title: Not just hocus pocus: when words were used to treat the sick
events.summary: Incantations were not only meant to ward off demons, but also to calm patients. A look into medical history reveals what lies behind the idea of tooth worms and the power of utterances like "hocus pocus."

events.title: France court rejects request to suspend Shein
events.summary: The French government aimed to suspend Shein after child-like sex dolls and other illicit items were found on the platform. The site instead has been ordered to implement age-verification measures.

events.title: What do Ukrainians want from a peace agreement?
events.summary: Polls say that Ukrainians want peace, but not at any cost. What are the red lines and what would they be willing to compromise on?

events.title: EU secures Ukraine funding while exposing limits of unity
events.summary: The EU's late-night compromise ensures Ukraine's budget for the next two years, but shifts the burden onto EU finances while postponing a decisive test of how far Europe is willing to go to use Russian frozen assets.

events.title: 3I/ATLAS: Interstellar comet comes closest to Earth
events.summary: Sometimes "the universe comes to us," writes the European Space Agency. On Friday it came really close, when comet 3l/ATLAS passed by us at a ― relatively ― short distance. What exactly is this interstellar visitor?

events.title: Netflix vs. Paramount takeover battle for Warner Bros.: What's at stake?
events.summary: The multi-billion dollar bidding war to acquire Warner Bros. may soon be over. How are the negotiations connected to Harry Potter, Trump, TikTok — and the future of cinema?

events.title: Germany news: Tendency to save money highest since 2008
events.summary: A new poll suggests consumers are returning to economic uncertainty, amid rising inflation fears and debates about the future of pensions. Meanwhile, lawmakers are discussing German-US relations.

events.title: German business bankruptcies hit decade high amid downturn
events.summary: Business bankruptcies have climbed to an 11-year high, with small firms hardest hit by Germany's anemic growth. Economists warn of job losses but see tentative signs that the insolvency wave may be leveling off.

events.title: Five things to know about AFCON
events.summary: Excellent infrastructure, ambitious teams, young stars and veterans who are far from finished — the 35th edition of AFCON promises plenty.

events.title: Can Santa Claus survive in a melting world?
events.summary: As climate change warms the planet, snowy winters are becoming less certain in Europe. Those looking for classic Christmas traditions are learning to adapt.

events.title: Germany: Magdeburg Christmas market 1 year after attack
events.summary: In the eastern city of Magdeburg, people are still grieving one year after an attack on the Christmas market killed six people. But residents are also trying to carry on despite the heightened security.

events.title: ECJ says Polish Constitutional Court lacks independence, violated EU values
events.summary: The European Court of Justice ruled that Poland's Constitutional Court breached EU law and judicial independence, reigniting a dispute over measures to remake the judiciary by the former government.

events.title: Plane owned by ex-NASCAR driver Greg Biffle crashes in US
events.summary: A small aircraft owned by Greg Biffle crashed and exploded while attempting to land at Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina. Seven people died in the crash, including the 56-year-old retired NASCAR driver.

events.title: Pioneering gay rights filmmaker Rosa von Praunheim dies at 83
events.summary: His 1971 film "It Is Not the Homosexual Who Is Perverse, but the Society in Which He Lives" is widely credited with triggering the modern gay rights movement in German-language countries.

events.title: Bayern Munich buy ex-Bundesliga stadium for women's team
events.summary: Bayern Munich are set to purchase a larger stadium for their women's team. The club's CEO described the move as "another milestone" for Bayern's women's program.

events.title: Women's health suffers, bearing the brunt of household labor
events.summary: Even as economic roles shift in romantic partnerships, women still shoulder most of the labor at home. Research suggests this is a burden affecting women's health, leading to emotional fatigue and depression.

events.title: Euro 2029 in Germany about more than profit margins
events.summary: Hosting Euro 2029 is a chance for women's football in Germany to leave a legacy beyond profit and prove investment in women is smart move.

events.title: Cheaper, cleaner energy drives Germany's balcony-solar boom
events.summary: The home-fitted renewable-energy sources are inexpensive and easy to install, and reduce electricity costs. Here's what can be learned from their surging popularity in Germany.

events.title: Merz touts EU-Mercosur deal while France, Italy protest
events.summary: The EU-Latin America trade deal has been in the making for a quarter of a century. Though Germany's chancellor called for its completion, France and Italy said it would be "premature" to sign.

events.title: Wealthy nations curb labor migration as demand surges
events.summary: Even before Donald Trump returned to the White House, anti-immigration politics were reshaping migration flows to high-income countries. Borders have been tightened despite economies facing urgent labor shortages.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' hit a record
events.summary: Silver just reached an all-time high of $67. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Germany news: Lawmakers back €50 billion defense package
events.summary: The Bundestag budget committee has signed off on more than €50 billion in military purchases. The Cabinet is proposing tighter rules for welfare recipients.

events.title: Venezuela blockade: What it would mean for the Maduro regime and oil markets
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has threatened Venezuela with a naval blockade to thwart its oil exports — a move that would hit the Maduro government hard but may leave global oil markets unfazed.

events.title: Why US giant Chevron, not China, may save oil-rich Venezuela
events.summary: Chevron is driving Venezuela's oil rebound while China is pulling back. As the fate of President Nicolas Maduro grows uncertain, Washington's renewed leverage is reshaping the country's economic and geopolitical future.

events.title: Louvre partially back in action despite walkout
events.summary: Louvre workers voted to extend a strike as security scrutiny at the world famous museum intensifies.

events.title: Beethovenhalle reopens: The return of a German cultural icon
events.summary: After almost 10 years of renovation, Bonn's Beethovenhalle is back to its former splendor. Opened in the late 1950s, it soon became an important symbol of democracy in the newly founded Federal Republic of Germany.

events.title: AFCON offers hope after World Cup heartbreak
events.summary: Several established African teams ,like Nigeria, did not qualify for World Cup 2026 despite an expanded format. The Africa Cup of Nations, which begins this weekend, offers a different challenge and a chance to build.

events.title: Under-fire FIFA announces $60 World Cup tickets, for the few
events.summary: The good news? FIFA responded to outrage at the most expensive World Cup ever with discount tickets comparable to the cost of a normal game for "loyal fans." The bad news? It's for a tiny share of the tickets.

events.title: Why Germany's auto capitals face financial crisis
events.summary: The crisis in Germany’s revered car industry is taking a toll on its wealthiest regions — and hitting the pocketbooks of residents.

events.title: Messi's India tour and rise of the solo athlete sports brand
events.summary: In 2025, many global sports stars went on promotional tours purely to support their individual brands. Lionel Messi's tour of India is a reminder of how sport is changing.

events.title: Gas-loving Trump cedes electric car market to China
events.summary: Donald Trump is pushing gas guzzlers over EVs — in spite of climate and cost concerns. China is now set to race further ahead into an electrified automotive future.

events.title: A German tip for your New Year's resolutions
events.summary: Starting off the year with ambitious plans to become a better person is a widespread Western tradition. What are the most popular resolutions in Germany? And here's how the German language can help you deal with yours.

events.title: Medical experts are pushing back on new US vaccine policy
events.summary: US health agencies under Robert F Kennedy Jr. and American medical groups are in conflict over childhood vaccination policy. At the heart of the clash is a long debunked, persistent myth about vaccine safety.

events.title: Why China's property crash must be kept top secret
events.summary: As home sales continue to plummet, Beijing has curbed independent reporting of real estate figures. The gag order masks a deepening property slump that continues to erode household wealth and strain China's banks.

events.title: Jane Austen at 250: From Regency roots to TikTok reels
events.summary: The English author's works fuel feminist debates, rom-coms and TikTok memes, proving her satire still lands across diverse cultural contexts more than two centuries on.

events.title: How the world's first global trader, Jakob Fugger, got rich
events.summary: Some 500 years ago, Jakob Fugger was the richest man alive. The German financed emperors and popes, and reshaped global trade and banking to set the economic course for the modern world.

events.title: What Russia's 'undesirable' designation means for DW
events.summary: Russia has designated Deutsche Welle an "undesirable organization." How can users stay in touch with DW without risking prosecution by Russian authorities?

events.title: Germany: 5 arrested for suspected Christmas market plot
events.summary: The five men are suspected of planning an Islamist-motivated attack on a Christmas market in southern Germany, the Munich public prosecutor's office said.

events.title: A pre-Christmas warning: Cheap toys can pose health hazard
events.summary: For kids, presents are meant to be a source of happiness and fun. But some plastic gifts can be a health risk. Here's why.

events.title: Can Lionel Messi's visit boost Indian football?
events.summary: As Lionel Messi embarks on a four-city tour of India, the footballing community there is hoping it will have a long-term impact on the state of global game in a country where cricket remains king.

events.title: Germany's housing market 'contaminated' by widespread racism
events.summary: Black and Muslim people are disproportionately discriminated against on the real estate market in Germany, according to a new study. Just having a foreign-sounding name can lead to fewer apartment viewings.

events.title: What is Hanukkah and how is it celebrated?
events.summary: Starting on December 14, Jews will celebrate the eight-day festival of Hanukkah, commemorating the rededication of Jerusalem's Second Temple in 200 B.C.

events.title: Holiday stargazing: meteor showers and supermoons ahead
events.summary: One of the biggest meteor showers of the year will peak in mid-December, ahead of an early January supermoon.

events.title: Catastrophic US floods linked to hotter climate
events.summary: Rising temperatures and extreme rainfall might not seem connected, but they often are. Here's how.

events.title: Eurovision winner Nemo returns trophy over Israel's 2026 participation
events.summary: Last year's winner joins the protest wave following the decision to include Israel in the 2026 event. Five countries will also boycott Eurovision 2026.

events.title: African Youth Games important, but sustainability is key
events.summary: Seven years after the last edition, Africa's sports stars of tomorrow are getting the chance to compete and develop their talent in Angola.

events.title: Swiss yodeling, yurt-making, Turkmen Alabay join UNESCO list
events.summary: All manner of global customs have been added to UNESCO's intangible cultural heritage list at its Delhi meeting — from yodeling to Alabay dog breeding and from Italian cuisine to yurt-making skills and Al Sadu weaving.

events.title: India's 2026 space bid: Three Gaganyaan missions by March
events.summary: Can India overcome years of delays to finally send its own spacecraft astronauts into orbit? That depends on crucial launches in the coming months.

events.title: Goodbye climate protection? How the EU is weakening its Green Deal
events.summary: European industrial and agricultural concerns are facing diluted environmental regulations, while the bloc as a whole has reduced its climate targets. What's at stake and how do far-right parties feature in the mix?

events.title: New film about Mother Teresa portrays a flawed Catholic icon
events.summary: Set in India in the 1940s, the film "Mother" depicts a nun torn between self-doubt, strict principles and self-sacrifice. It also asks the question: Was Teresa a feminist?

events.title: FBL aiming to take women's football in Germany to new level
events.summary: The football clubs that make up the Bundesliga have gone it alone in forming a new league organization to better develop and market the women's game in Germany.

events.title: Crude oil shoots from damaged pipeline in eastern Germany
events.summary: Brandenburg's state Environment Ministry warned of a "large oil spill" after a pipeline accident. It said that emergency services were on site and that details on the size and cause of the spill were not yet available.

events.title: Germany: Activists upset Chancellor Merz with CDU memorial
events.summary: A political artists' collective has placed a statue of murdered politician Walter Lübcke outside CDU headquarters. Lübcke was killed by a supporter of the far-right AfD, which the activists are warning against.

events.title: German history museum offers fresh take on postwar years
events.summary: The new permanent exhibition at the Haus der Geschichte in Bonn brings 80 years of German history to life, including the post-war period, the fall of the Berlin Wall — and concluding with present-day protests.

events.title: Too close to Trump? FIFA President Infantino under pressure
events.summary: FairSquare has accused FIFA President Gianni Infantino of repeatedly violating political neutrality. The NGO is calling for an investigation, also because of a peace prize awarded to Donald Trump.

events.title: Are mosquitoes the most dangerous animals in the world?
events.summary: Malaria, dengue, Zika virus and West Nile fever are all diseases that can be spread by mosquitoes. Hundreds of thousands of people die from such infections every year.

events.title: Russian threats spark calls for tighter German security
events.summary: Germany's intelligence service is pushing for more powers in the fight against espionage and sabotage. This would mean an overhaul of security laws.

events.title: RB Leipzig make Tatjana Haenni Bundesliga's first woman CEO
events.summary: RB Leipzig's appointment of Tatjana Haenni makes her the first woman to hold the post of CEO at a Bundesliga club.

events.title: EU delays decision over ban on veggie labels
events.summary: European lawmakers failed to reach a deal on whether ordinary consumers would be confused by the idea of vegetarian sausages or vegan burgers. Meat producers say it's not that simple.

events.title: Germany: Temporary migrants account for 8.8% of suspects
events.summary: Of the criminal suspects known to Germany's federal investigative police force in 2024, 8.8% were temporary migrants like asylum seekers, 35.4% were non-German citizens, and 64.6% were German nationals.

events.title: New strain of mpox virus: What you need to know
events.summary: A hybrid form of mpox has been identified in the UK. Health professionals are not surprised that the sexually transmitted virus has evolved but say it's a reminder of the need for precaution.

events.title: Poland: A trillion‑dollar player knocking on the G20's door
events.summary: Poland has been invited to observe the G20 summit in Miami next year. Full membership in the elite club may still be years away, but could it finally put Central Europe on the global map?

events.title: UN environment head warns of climate complacency
events.summary: Trillions of dollars could be gained every year and millions of lives saved from protecting the climate and environment, according to the UN. DW speaks to Inger Andersen about what might help us get there.

events.title: Germany steps up missile defense with help from Israel
events.summary: Germany is upgrading its defenses: the Arrow 3, developed by the US and Israel, is designed to intercept missiles in space.

events.title: Why Japan's economic woes spark global market concern
events.summary: Japan's PM Sanae Takaichi wants to spend big to boost sluggish growth, despite the country's already huge debt load. With bond yields already rising, a sudden spike could shock the financial world well beyond Japan.

events.title: Tropical cyclones: Why are some countries more at risk?
events.summary: When tropical storms make headlines, certain countries and regions are repeatedly part of the story. Why is that and what fuels cyclones and their paths?

events.title: Google raises AI stakes as OpenAI struggles to stay on top
events.summary: Google's new Gemini 3 model challenges OpenAI's dominance in the global artificial intelligence (AI) race. As rivals invest billions and competition grows, OpenAI faces pressure to innovate — and finally turn a profit.

events.title: Germany's Wadephul pushes for fair trade in China
events.summary: Johann Wadephul said that Berlin intends to expand its trade partnership with China. The German foreign minister had originally planned to travel to China in October, but the trip was delayed due to tensions over Taiwan.

events.title: German aviation tax cut to offer little lift amid jet shortage
events.summary: Germany's aviation industry faces high operating costs — from ticket taxes to aviation security charges. But despite fresh political efforts to reduce that burden, the real bottleneck is a global shortage of planes.

events.title: Sports clubs in Germany: Unique thanks to their coaches
events.summary: The culture of German sports clubs is like no other. Thanks to volunteer work, you can participate in and train for almost any sport at a low cost. Enthusiastic coaches are crucial to this.

events.title: New AI model can predict 5-year breast cancer risk
events.summary: A new AI model can predict a person's risk of developing breast cancer up to five years in advance by analyzing mammograms. This could make screening much more effective.

events.title: New discovery: The 'sacred boundary' surrounding Stonehenge
events.summary: Long thought to be an assortment of mysterious holes near Stonehenge, researchers have now used new technologies to better understand the culture that dug a circle of ditches around the monument in southern England.

events.title: World Cup 2026 draw: Germany to face Curacao, Trump wins prize
events.summary: US President Donald Trump was awarded the inaugural FIFA Peace Prize at the 2026 World Cup draw, as the groups for the tournament were selected.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga clubs to market league without DFB
events.summary: German football has been rocked by an announcement that the clubs of the women's Bundesliga plan to form a new association to market the league — without Germany's football association.

events.title: Finland: The money woes of the world's happiest country
events.summary: Finland cut Russian energy imports and closed the shared border after the Ukraine war, erasing €12 billion in trade. The shocks deepened the Nordic nation's deficit, already strained by defense and welfare spending.

events.title: Why undoing the EU's 2035 combustion engine ban spooks some in the auto sector
events.summary: The EU will soon unveil a new plan to curb CO2 emissions in Europe's car sector, likely loosening an all-out 2035 ban of sales of combustion engine cars. But some businesses face more stringent electrification quotas.

events.title: Iranian FA drops plan to boycott 2026 World Cup draw
events.summary: Iran is to be represented at Friday's draw for the 2026 World Cup. The country's FA had previously said it would boycott the draw after several members of its planned delegation were denied visas for the United States.

events.title: US 'Cancer Alley' residents stand up to petrochemical giants
events.summary: Residents say a dense cluster of industry on the banks of the Mississippi River is causing serious health problems. Now, as plastic production surges globally, they're fighting for cleaner communities.

events.title: Virus has killed almost 9 million birds ― and counting
events.summary: Authorities say bird flu poses a low risk to people right now, but in animals — both wild and domestic — it's causing global devastation. If left uncontrolled, it could also mutate into something far worse for humans.

events.title: Solar energy protects German vineyards from climate change
events.summary: As viticulture suffers from the effects of climate change, German researchers are experimenting with technology that fosters growth while also harvesting electricity.

events.title: Chinese drills around Taiwan after US and Japan show support towards the island
events.summary: China this morning conducted live-fire military drills in waters around Taiwan, aimed, it says, as a warning against separatist forces in the self-ruled island. Codenamed "Justice Mission 2025", the drills come just ten days after the Trump administration announced Washington's largest ever arms package for Taipei, and Japan's claim that it would intervene in the event of China attacking Taiwan.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot remembered for acting, activism and controversial politics
events.summary: After the death of Brigitte Bardot this Sunday, the international press has been paying tribute to the film star, singer and animal rights activist. While she is celebrated for her contribution to cinema, many criticise her turn towards the extreme right in later life, and convictions for hate speech and racist speech - mostly about Muslims, but also the inhabitants of the French island of Reunion whom she described as "savages".

events.title: China launches military drills simulating blockade of Taiwan ports
events.summary: China launched live-fire drills around Taiwan on December 29 that it said would simulate a blockade of the self-ruled island's key ports. The decision follows a bumper round of arms sales to Taipei by the United States, Taiwan's main security backer. For US President Donald Trump, it is a way of containing China and bargain with Beijing. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle tells us more.

events.title: Myanmar pro-military party claims win in controversial election
events.summary: Myanmar's dominant pro-military party claimed an overwhelming victory in the first phase of the elections after democracy watchdogs warned the junta-run poll would entrench military rule. The election win will be a way for the ruling junta, in power after a military coup in 2021 against the elected government, to legitimise its governance. Elections were only open in areas under junta control, and there have been reports of the military forcing civilians to vote at gunpoint.

events.title: People are 'looking for more meaningful tourism'
events.summary: Paris and Barcelona are some of the cities which were the most visited in the world this year. But with 2026 starting soon, what will travelling look like in the year to come? With films and TV series like The White Lotus creating new travelling trends, people are also "looking for more meaningful tourism" Carl Cater, Associate Professor in Tourism at Swansea University, tells FRANCE 24.

events.title: Ukraine talks: Peace plan '90% agreed' as Trump hosts Zelensky
events.summary: US President Donald Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Florida to discuss a draft peace framework aimed at ending Russia’s war. Ukraine is seeking long-term US security guarantees, with Zelensky saying he has asked Trump for commitments lasting up to 50 years, beyond the 15 years currently envisaged.

events.title: Thorny questions remain despite positive meeting reports from Trump and Zelensky
events.summary: US President Donald Turmp and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky both reported progress on two of the most contentious issues regarding a peace deal in Ukraine: security guarantees for the country and the division of the eastern Donbas region, which Russia is trying to capture. But thorny questions remain. David Smith, Washington Bureau Chief for The Guardian, told us more.

events.title: Winter rains flood camps, worsening living conditions for displaced Gazans
events.summary: Rain lashed the Gaza Strip, flooding makeshift encampments with ankle-deep puddles as Palestinians displaced by the two-year war attempted to stay dry in tents frayed by months of use. The flooding came as Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu travelled to Florida to discuss the second phase of the ceasefire agreement with US President Donald Trump.

events.title: E-commerce giant Coupang offers €1 billion compensation scheme after massive data breach
events.summary: Over a month after announcing a massive data breach affecting 34 million of its users, South Korean e-commerce company Coupang announced this Monday it would offer 1.69 trillion won in compensation (around €1 billion) to customers in the form of vouchers. Also in this edition, former EU digital chief Thierry Breton gives his first interview since being sanctioned by the US. Plus, Nokia's archived mobile design plans are now open to the public.

events.title: Thailand's army says Cambodia violated truce with more than 250 drones
events.summary: Thailand's army on Monday accused Cambodia of violating a newly signed ceasefire agreement, reached following weeks of deadly border clashes, after "more than 250 unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) were detected flying from the Cambodian side, intruding into Thailand's sovereign territory" on Sunday night, according to a statement.

events.title: Myanmar's pro-military party 'winning a majority' in junta-run poll, official says
events.summary: Myanmar's dominant pro-military party is "winning a majority" in the first phase of junta-run elections, a party source said on Monday, after democracy watchdogs warned the poll would entrench military rule. The vote has been widely condemned for its stark crackdown on dissent and a candidate list stacked with military allies.

events.title: Netanyahu and Trump to meet in Florida to discuss second phase of Gaza ceasefire
events.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump will meet in Florida on Monday to discuss the next stage of the fragile Gaza truce plan. Under the second phase of the ceasefire, Israel is due to withdraw from its positions in Gaza, while Hamas is supposed to lay down its weapons – a major sticking point in the discussions.

events.title: After 2025 recognition of a Palestinian state, what's next ?
events.summary: The recognition of the State of Palestine by several Western countries in September, at France’s initiative, stood out as one of the key diplomatic moments of 2025. Largely symbolic for Palestinians, the move raised questions about whether it could break a decades-long geopolitical stalemate.

events.title: Live: Russia agrees with Trump that Ukraine talks are in their final stages
events.summary: The Kremlin on Monday said it agreed with US President Donald Trump that talks to end the Ukraine war were in their final stages. The news came after President Emmanuel Macron announced that allies of Kyiv would discuss security guarantees for Ukraine in Paris next month. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi to return to action in Morocco's final AFCON group stage match
events.summary: Morocco captain Achraf Hakimi is set to return to action for his team's final AFCON group stage match against Zambia, having recovered from an ankle injury that sidelined him for nearly two months.

events.title: Kim oversees cruise missile launch as North Korea touts nuclear readiness
events.summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un oversaw the launch of long-range strategic cruise missiles on Sunday, state media said, as Pyongyang stepped up military activity it says is aimed at reinforcing its nuclear deterrent amid what it calls growing security threats.

events.title: China conducts large-scale Taiwan drills amid rising tensions
events.summary: China mobilised army, naval, air force and artillery units around Taiwan on Monday for its "Justice Mission 2025" exercises. Taipei responded by deploying troops to rehearse repelling a potential Chinese attack, underscoring the island's commitment to defending democracy amid escalating regional tensions.

events.title: Trump to press Netanyahu on stalled Gaza ceasefire, Iran and Lebanon
events.summary: US President Donald Trump is expected to push for progress on the faltering Gaza ceasefire when he meets Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday, with talks also set to cover Israel’s security concerns over Hezbollah in Lebanon and Iran.

events.title: Sudan's resilience at AFCON rewarded with first win
events.summary: With a 1-0 victory over Equatorial Guinea, Sudan get their first AFCON win since 2012, despite having to prepare during the brutal conflict at home.

events.title: Kosovo's Prime Minister Kurti set for second term after decisive election win
events.summary: Kosovo’s Prime Minister Albin Kurti looked poised to secure another term on Sunday after his Self-Determination party won a snap parliamentary election by a wide margin, preliminary results showed, ending months of political deadlock in the Balkan country.

events.title: Algeria secure knock-out spot with 1-0 win over Burkina Faso
events.summary: Algeria fans have celebrated their team's early qualification for the knockout stages of AFCON after Algeria beat Burkina Faso 1-0 in Rabat.

events.title: Trump, Zelensky say Ukraine peace deal edging closer but key issues unresolved
events.summary: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday that talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were moving “very close” to an agreement to end the war in Ukraine, though both leaders acknowledged that major sticking points, including territory and security guarantees, remain unresolved.

events.title: Algeria confirm qualification, Ivory Coast and Cameroon stay level
events.summary: This Sunday saw the final matches of the second round of AFCON group stage games. In group E, Equatorial Guinea lost to Sudan after an own goal by the National Thunder's Saul Coco. Algeria meanwhile got their ticket to the knockout stages thanks to a converted penalty in the first half. In group F, Gabon and Mozambique exchanged a flurry of shots on goal, but in the end it was disappointment for Gabon as the Mambas won 3-2. Finally, Ivory Coast and Cameroon battled it out for the top of their group, but stayed level in a very tight game.

events.title: Analyst: Trump ’delusional’ if he thinks Putin is serious about ending war in Ukraine
events.summary: US President Donald Trump is “delusional” if he thinks that his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin is serious about wanting to end the war in Ukraine any time soon, Melinda Haring, a senior analyst at the Atlantic Council’s Eurasia Center, told FRANCE 24.

events.title: 'One or two thorny issues' remain after Ukraine peace deal talks, Trump says
events.summary: Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they have made "a lot of progress" towards finalising a peace agreement to end Russia's war in Ukraine - although "one or two very thorny issues" remain.

events.title: Zelenskyy's reaction to Trump said it all as his poker face slipped after peace talks
events.summary: Not going backwards is a win. Given Donald Trump's fraught relationship with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, that's important.

events.title: Activist apologies over historic 'extremist' tweets - as Starmer faces deportation pressure
events.summary: A British-Egyptian activist has apologised "unequivocally" for "shocking and hurtful" past social media posts in which he appears to call for violence against "Zionists" - but said some had been "completely twisted".

events.title: At least 13 people dead after train derails in Mexico
events.summary: At least 13 people have died and dozens more are being treated for their injuries after a train derailed in Mexico, authorities have said.

events.title: Three war fronts on the agenda as Netanyahu set for talks with Trump
events.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is on his way to meet US President Donald Trump in Florida.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot: The bombshell and style icon who walked away from fame and glamour
events.summary: Brigitte Bardot was the sultry film siren who helped ignite a sexual revolution, a woman whose cultural significance extended beyond her acting career.

events.title: 'Massive numbers' of police to be deployed for Sydney New Year's Eve celebrations
events.summary: People in Sydney have been urged to show "defiance" and celebrate New Year's Eve in the wake of the deadly terror attack in Bondi Beach earlier this month.

events.title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka to win 'Battle of the Sexes' tennis match
events.summary: Nick Kyrgios has defeated Aryna Sabalenka to win the latest "Battle of the Sexes" tennis exhibition match.

events.title: The harsh reality of life in Gaza under US-backed ceasefire
events.summary: Warning: This article contains images and descriptions some people may find distressing

events.title: The most shocking, unusual and WTF moments of 2025
events.summary: In a year full of serious news, there were some stories that you may have had to look at twice in disbelief.

events.title: Hungary's 'water guardian' farmers fight back against desertification
events.summary: Southern Hungary landowner Oszkár Nagyapáti has been battling severe drought on his land

events.title: Russia sends 3 Iranian satellites into orbit, report says
events.summary: Iran's state television says that Russia has sent three Iranian communications satellites into orbit

events.title: At least 3 dead, including 1-year-old, in building collapse in South Africa
events.summary: Three people, including a child, have died after a two-story building collapsed in Soweto, South Africa

events.title: Indonesian rescuers find a body while searching for soccer coach and 3 children
events.summary: Indonesian rescuers say they have recovered the body of a female victim believed to be part of the family of a Spanish soccer coach and his three children, missing after a tour boat sank Friday

events.title: Protesting students in Serbia urge support for early election they hope will oust Vucic
events.summary: Protesting university students in Serbia have collected signatures throughout the country for their request for an early parliamentary election

events.title: Mexican president says 13 people died in the Interoceanic Train derailment in southern Mexico
events.summary: Mexican president says 13 people died in the Interoceanic Train derailment in southern Mexico

events.title: Families of Bondi Beach victims demand more federal action
events.summary: Families of victims of the recent Sydney massacre are urging more federal action to investigate rising antisemitism and security failures

events.title: Guineans vote in first election since 2021 coup with junta leader likely to win

events.title: Photos show Venezuelans celebrating Holy Innocents' Day
events.summary:
Hundreds of people in northern Venezuela took to the streets for the annual Bandos and Parrandas of the Holy Innocents of Caucagua, a celebration rooted in Afro-descendant cacao-growing communities. 

Marked on Dec. 28 alongside the Catholic Feast of the Holy Innocents, the festivity dates back more than 200 years, when enslaved people were given the day off and turned it into a moment of satire and resistance. Today, participants preserve that rebellious spirit by wearing costumes inspired by plantation owners and using humor, riddles and parody to poke fun at authority.

events.summary: During a press conference, President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said they are close to a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: A murder, a manhunt and the grandmother who wouldn't stop the search for her daughter's killer
events.summary: Josephine Wentzel spent years tracking down the suspect in her daughter’s death and is now helping others grieving cold cases.

events.title: Trump wants to bring Japan's 'cute' tiny cars to America — but it may not be easy
events.summary: It's all the truck he needs — one that picks up a new mattress from the furniture store, takes him to work and has ample space for groceries.“Most people have way more truck than they will ever use,” said David McChristian, 37, a firefighter from Houston.

events.title: How a child bride escaped Afghanistan and became a bodybuilding champion

events.title: Deadly attacks in Australia and Syria show a diminished ISIS is still a threat
events.summary: A pair of deadly attacks in Syria and Australia has shone a fresh spotlight on the Islamic State, the militant group.

events.title: At Gaza's only animal shelter, workers share what food they have with hungry dogs and cats
events.summary: A humble shelter operating out of a tent remains the last beacon of hope for the injured and hungry animal population in war-ravaged Gaza, even as its workers and volunteers face their own impossible conditions.“You cannot look at a creature that trusts you and eat in front of it without sharing,” Saeed Al-Aar, who founded the Sulala Animal Rescue shelter in 2006, told NBC News last month

events.title: Brigitte Bardot, French actor and animal rights activist, dies at 91
events.summary: Screen siren Brigitte Bardot, whose portrayals of free-spirited ingenues made her an international sex symbol and the pride of France, and who turned her back on movie stardom in 1973 to become an animal rights activist, has died, according to French media and The Associated Press

events.title: Security guarantees remain critical issue ahead of Zelenskyy's meeting with Trump

events.title: Trump and Zelenskyy to meet Sunday in Florida
events.summary: As Ukraine expressed willingness to withdraw troops from some occupied regions, Russia gave no indication it was ready to pull back from territory it has seized.

events.title: Europe pushes back at Trump's 'authoritarian' sanctions on anti-disinformation figures
events.summary: The State Department sanctioned Thierry Breton, Imran Ahmed, Clare Melford, Anna-Lena von Hodenberg and Josephine Ballon for "egregious acts" of censorship.

events.title: U.S. says it struck ISIS in Nigeria after Trump warns of attacks on Christians
events.summary: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he ordered “numerous” strikes on Islamic State terrorists in Nigeria he accused of killing Christians.“The United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!” Trump said in a post on Truth Social

events.title: Top-end iPhones on sale in Gaza as food and medicine trickle into territory
